hints.content:
Let's put our numbers into a place value table.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
- | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\maroonD{560}$ |  $\maroonD5$ | $\maroonD6$ | $\maroonD0$
$\blueE{336}$ | $\blueE3$ | $\blueE3$ | $\blueE6$

Now, we can break apart each number by place value.

$\maroonD{560}=\maroonD{5\text{ hundreds}} + \maroonD{6\text{ tens}}$.  

$\blueE{336}=\blueE{3\text{ hundreds}} + \blueE{3\text{ tens}}+ \blueE{6\text{ ones}}$.
$5\text{ hundreds} + 3\text{ hundreds} +6 \text{ tens}+3\text{ tens} +6 \text{ ones}$ is the same as $560 + 336$.

question.content:
**Which addition problem is the same as $560+336$?**
